item.title: Ray Dalio says the world is running out of interest in buying U.S. debt—but America is unable to cut back its spending
item.description: But Dalio, speaking at the Future China Global Forum in Singapore this week, doesn't think the U.S. is in a position to pull back on its spending.

item.title: The Fed’s cut was ‘more hawkish than anticipated,’ Moody’s Zandi says — and warns it won’t be enough to stave off a looming jobs recession
item.description: The market didn’t get the dovish signal it was looking for.

item.title: Gen Z college grads are flocking to Texas and Florida where companies have ‘overwhelmingly’ relocated their headquarters
item.description: These markets are becoming nearly as popular as New York and San Francisco.

item.title: Trump may use tariff revenue to bail out farmers, agriculture secretary says. They’re reeling from challenges caused by the levies to begin with
item.description: Subsidies to farmers in rural America may ease their financial troubles, but the erosion of agricultural markets as a result of tariffs will remain, o...

item.title: The great AI commerce startup opportunity, according to Andreessen Horowitz
item.description: A16Z's Alex Rampell and Justine Moore go deep on the ramifications of rapidly changing consumer behavior.
